abstract: What in the World column; some South Koreans have been signing up to experience mock funeral service in order to better appreciate their lives; participants in free program run by Hyowon Healing Center in Seoul write their last testaments and then spend 10 minutes shut in coffin.

headline.print_headline: Seeking New Zest for Life, Koreans Give Death a Try
headline.main: South Koreans, Seeking New Zest for Life, Experience Their Own Funerals

snippet: Participants of the mock funeral program write a testament, don a shroud, and climb in a coffin, which is then hammered shut for 10 long minutes....
lead_paragraph: Participants of the mock funeral program write a testament, don a shroud, and climb in a coffin, which is then hammered shut for 10 long minutes.
